com.conceptwave.scripting
Class Date

com.conceptwave.scripting.Object
  com.conceptwave.scripting.Date

public class Date
extends com.conceptwave.scripting.Object

Constructor Summary
Date()
          Allocates a Date object and initializes it so that it represents the time at which it was allocated, measured to the nearest millisecond.
Date(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer millisec)
          Allocates a Date object and initializes it so that it represents the instant at the start of the minute specified by the mills argument , in the local time zone.
Date(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer year, com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer month, com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer day, com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalHours, com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalMinutes, com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalSeconds, com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalMillisec)
          Allocates a Date object and initializes it so that it represents the instant at the start of the second specified by the year, month, date, hrs, min, and sec arguments, in the local time zone.
Date(String datestring)
          Allocates a Date object and initializes it so that it represents the date and time indicated by the string s, which is interpreted as if by the parse(java.lang.String) method.

static com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer UTC(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer year, com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer month, com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer day, com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalHours, com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalMinutes, com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalSeconds, com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalMillisec)
          Accepts the same parameters as the longest form of the constructor, and returns the number of milliseconds in a Date object since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00, universal time.
 

Constructor Detail

Date

public Date()
Allocates a Date object and initializes it so that it represents the time at which it was allocated, measured to the nearest millisecond.

Date

public Date(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer millisec)
Allocates a Date object and initializes it so that it represents the instant at the start of the minute specified by the mills argument , in the local time zone.

Parameters:
millisec - Integer value representing the number of milliseconds since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC.

Date

public Date(String datestring)
Allocates a Date object and initializes it so that it represents the date and time indicated by the string s, which is interpreted as if by the parse(java.lang.String) method.

Parameters:
millisec - a string representation of the date.

Date

public Date(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer year,
            com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer month,
            com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer day,
            com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalHours,
            com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalMinutes,
            com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalSeconds,
            com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalMillisec)
Allocates a Date object and initializes it so that it represents the instant at the start of the second specified by the year, month, date, hrs, min, and sec arguments, in the local time zone.

Parameters:
year - the year minus 1900.
month - the month between 0-11.
day - the day of the month between 1-31.
optionalHours - the hours between 0-23.
optionalMinutes - the minutes between 0-59.
optionalSeconds - the seconds between 0-59.
optionalMillisec - Integer value representing the number of milliseconds since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC.
Method Detail

getDate

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getDate()
The value returned by getDate is an integer between 1 and 31.

Returns:
Returns the day of the month for the specified date according to local time

getDay

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getDay()
The value returned by getDay is an integer corresponding to the day of the week: 0 for Sunday, 1 for Monday, 2 for Tuesday, and so on.

Returns:
Returns the day of the week for the specified date according to local time

getHours

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getHours()
The value returned by getHours is an integer between 0 and 23.

Returns:
Returns the hour in the specified date according to local time.

getMilliseconds

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getMilliseconds()
The value returned by getMilliseconds is a number between 0 and 999.

Returns:
Returns the milliseconds in the specified date according to local time.

getMinutes

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getMinutes()
The value returned by getMinutes is an integer between 0 and 59.

Returns:
Returns the minutes in the specified date according to local time.

getMonth

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getMonth()
The value returned by getMonth is an integer between 0 and 11. 0 corresponds to January, 1 to February, and so on.

Returns:
Returns the month in the specified date according to local time.

getSeconds

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getSeconds()
The value returned by getSeconds is an integer between 0 and 59.

Returns:
Returns the seconds in the specified date according to local time.

getTime

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getTime()
The value returned by the getTime method is the number of milliseconds since 1 January 1970 00:00:00. You can use this method to help assign a date and time to another Date object.

Returns:
Returns the numeric value of the specified date as the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

getTimezoneOffset

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getTimezoneOffset()
The time-zone offset is the minutes in difference, the Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) is relative to your local time. For example, if your time zone is GMT+10, -600 will be returned. Daylight savings time prevents this value from being a constant.

Returns:
Returns the time-zone offset in minutes for the current locale.

getUTCDate

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getUTCDate()
The value returned by getUTCDate is an integer between 1 and 31.

Returns:
Returns the day (date) of the month in the specified date according to universal time.

getUTCDay

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getUTCDay()
The value returned by getUTCDay is an integer corresponding to the day of the week: 0 for Sunday, 1 for Monday, 2 for Tuesday, and so on.

Returns:
Returns the day of the week in the specified date according to universal time.

getUTCFullYear

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getUTCFullYear()
The value returned by getUTCFullYear is an absolute number that is compliant with year-2000, for example, 1995.

Returns:
Returns the year in the specified date according to universal time.

getUTCHours

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getUTCHours()
The value returned by getUTCHours is an integer between 0 and 23.

Returns:
Returns the hours in the specified date according to universal time.

getUTCMilliseconds

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getUTCMilliseconds()
The value returned by getUTCMilliseconds is an integer between 0 and 999.

Returns:
Returns the milliseconds in the specified date according to universal time.

getUTCMinutes

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getUTCMinutes()
The value returned by getUTCMinutes is an integer between 0 and 59.

Returns:
Returns the minutes in the specified date according to universal time.

getUTCMonth

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getUTCMonth()
The value returned by getUTCMonth is an integer between 0 and 11 corresponding to the month. 0 for January, 1 for February, 2 for March, and so on.

Returns:
Returns the month in the specified date according to universal time.

getUTCSeconds

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getUTCSeconds()
The value returned by getUTCSeconds is an integer between 0 and 59.

Returns:
Returns the seconds in the specified date according to universal time.

getYear

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getYear()
Deprecated. getYear is no longer used and has been replaced by the getFullYear method.

Returns:
Returns the year in the specified date according to local time. Use getFullYear instead.

getFullYear

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer getFullYear()
The value returned by getFullYear() is a four integer representing the year of specified date.

parse

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer parse(String datestring)
The parse function applies the ToString operator to its argument and interprets the resulting string as a date

Parameters:
datestring - a local time, a UTC time, or a time in some other time zone, depending on the contents of the string.
Returns:
returns a number, the UTC time value corresponding to the date

Returns:

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer setYear(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer year)
Deprecated. setYear is no longer used and has been replaced by the setFullYear method.

Parameters:
year - An integer.

toGMTString

public String toGMTString()
Deprecated. toGMTString is no longer used and has been replaced by the toUTCString method.

Converts a date to a string, using the Internet GMT conventions. Use toUTCString instead.

toLocaleString

public String toLocaleString()
Converts a date to a string, using the current locale's conventions. Overrides the Object.toLocaleString method.

Returns:
Date in String format

toUTCString

public String toUTCString()
Converts a date to a string, using the universal time convention.

Returns:
Date in String format

UTC

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer UTC(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer year,
                                                    com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer month,
                                                    com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer day,
                                                    com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalHours,
                                                    com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalMinutes,
                                                    com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalSeconds,
                                                    com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalMillisec)
Accepts the same parameters as the longest form of the constructor, and returns the number of milliseconds in a Date object since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00, universal time.

Parameters:
year - A year after 1900.
month - An integer between 0 and 11 representing the month.
day - An integer between 1 and 31 representing the day of the month.
optionalHours - An integer between 0 and 23 representing the hours.
optionalMinutes - An integer between 0 and 59 representing the minutes.
optionalSeconds - An integer between 0 and 59 representing the seconds.
optionalMillisec - An integer between 0 and 999 representing the milliseconds.
Returns:
number of milliseconds in a Date object
